channel.title: large language models on The AI Talks
channel.description: Recent content in large language models on The AI Talks

item.title: Adaptive and Trustworthy NLP with Retrieval for Information Access for Everyone
item.description: Speaker Akari Asai is a Ph.D. student in the Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering at the University of Washington, advised by Prof. Hannaneh Hajishirzi. Her research lies in natural language processing and machine learning. Her recent research focuses on question answering / IR, multilingual NLP, retrieval-augmented LMs, and efficiency. She received the IBM Fellowship in 2022 and the Nakajima Foundation Fellowship in 2019 and is selected as a 2022 EECS Rising Star.
